contentrichtext.text: '''John Herkimer''' (1773 [[Tryon County, New York]] â€“ June 8, 1848 [[Danube, New York|Danube]], [[Herkimer County, New York]]) was an [[United States|American]] lawyer and politician from [[New York]]. ==Life== Herkimer was the son of George Herkimer (brother of Gen. [[Nicholas Herkimer]]). He was a member from [[Montgomery County, New York|Montgomery County]] of the [[New York State Assembly]] in 1800, 1804 and 1806. He was a delegate to the [[New York State Constitutional Convention]] of 1801. During the [[War of 1812]], he served in the State Militia as a Major, leading a battalion in the defense of [[Sackets Harbor, New York]]. In 1817, the Town of Danube (in which area Herkimer's home was located) was created from a part of the Town of [[Minden, New York|Minden]], and the area transferred from Montgomery to Herkimer County. Afterwards Herkimer was an associate judge of the Herkimer County Court for some years. Herkimer was elected as a [[Democratic-Republican Party|Democratic-Republican]] to the [[15th United States Congress|15th]] and the [[18th United States Congress]]es, holding office from March 4, 1817, to March 3, 1819; and from March 4, 1823, to March 3, 1825.
